1.brief: perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to be guilty; by implication to be punished or perish
to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill

2.brief: at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing)
properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, a pouring over, i.e. fusion of metal (especially a cast image); by implication, a libation, i.e. league; concretely a coverlet (as if poured out)
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
intelligence; by implication, an argument; by extension, caprice
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to slaughter an animal (usually in sacrifice)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
a (male) calf (as frisking round), especially one nearly grown (i.e. a steer)
to kiss, literally or figuratively (touch); also (as a mode of attachment), to equip with weapons

3.brief: properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a cloud (as covering the sky), i.e. the nimbus or thunder-cloud
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
literally, to load up (on the back of man or beast), i.e. to start early in the morning
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
chaff (as pressed out, i.e. winnowed or (rather) threshed loose)
to rush upon; by implication, to toss (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative)
a threshing-floor (as made even); by analogy, any open area
smoke, literally or figuratively (vapor, dust, anger)
a lattice; (by implication) a window, dovecot (because of the pigeon-holes), chimney (with its apertures for smoke), sluice (with openings for water)

4.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
probably scattering, i.e. removal; used adverbially, except
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
properly, a failure of, i.e. (used only as a negative particle, usually with a prepositional prefix) not, except, without, unless, besides, because not, until, etc.

5.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

6.brief: to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)
to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention

7.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
to spy out, i.e. (generally) survey, (for evil) lurk for, (for good) care for

8.brief: to come in contact with, whether by accident or violence; figuratively, to concur
to rend, literally or figuratively (revile, paint the eyes, as if enlarging them)
properly, shut up, i.e. the breast (as enclosing the heart); also gold (as generally shut up safely)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
to roar; a lion (properly, a lioness as the fiercer (although not a roarer;))
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
to cleave; generally, to rend, break, rip or open

Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

10.brief: strictly a demonstrative particle, here; but used of time, now or then
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
a head person (of any rank or class)

11.brief: to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
to take (in the widest variety of applications)

12.brief: to cramp, literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive
Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
to hide (by covering over); by implication, to hoard or reserve; figuratively to deny; specifically (favorably) to protect, (unfavorably) to lurk
an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender

13.brief: a rope (as twisted), especially a measuring line; by implication, a district or inheritance (as measured); or a noose (as of cords); figuratively, a company (as if tied together); also a throe (especially of parturition); also ruin
to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
the orifice of the womb (from which the fetus breaks forth)

to be the next of kin (and as such to buy back a relative's property, marry his widow, etc.)

an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

to bear fruit
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
the fore or front part; hence (by orientation) the East (often adverbially, eastward, for brevity the east wind)

a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed

a fountain (also collectively), figuratively, a source (of satisfaction)
